Thanks. I'm merging this one. The test that failed was a flume test that is sometimes flaky.
FYI This didn't get merged into branch-1.0. I did a manual cherry pick.

Ping I think this is ready for merging.  There's been some discussion about how to pass the implicit parameters to the methods (in two phases of discussion!) but I think we're in a good place with these right now and can expect to keep this API going forward.

This is the [PR](https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/931) which uses `ExternalAppendOnlyMap` to do external sort. I think it would be nice to use ExternalAppendOnlyMap as you guys mentioned before.

@harishreedharan The SparkSink is looking quite good. Had more minor comments. I am yet to look at the Spark Streaming receiver side.  Let me know about instructions to run this code locally. Assume that I dont know anythin about flume ;)
Jenkins, retest this please. (we've just switched over some of the test machines, so trying to figure out what's going on).
I just did a really light pass on the docs and public interfaces exposed. From that perspective, this looks good to me!

One small comment, otherwise LGTM. Thanks for catching this!
LGTM, just a few minor comments. Thanks a bunch!

Though with this patch, it is still possible that in the even rare case, the info is removed, and then add back again before this synchronized block is entered. then the read data operation should be ok, but we are synchronized on different info instance. This could hardly been resolved. I think unless you enlarge the synchronized scope  ( which might not be efficient ) or the blockInfo.get/put operation could employ read/write lock base on every single entry.
Thanks - I've merged this and back ported it into 0.9 and 1.0
Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/15845/
LGTM - thanks for the work on this. I'm going to go ahead and merge it.

@mengxr . I fix the format . And I did the test on hadoop-2.0.5-alpha and hadoop 2.2.0. The command line now works as usual. And my local yarn cluster is not working .I might test the run time exit later. Will let you know the result
